content: to create a slip knot and pull down on the ends to tighten the knot unravel the yarn using a yarn needle to achieve a curly look and trim ends into a rounded beard shape nose begin with magic_ring r1 single_crochet 6 into magic_ring pull tight to close 6 r2 increase single_crochet 2 repeat 8 r3 single_crochet around 8 cut a long end and weave through front loops of r3 to close leave ends loose for sewing nose to hat place nose over center stitches of beard and sew into place using the exposed back loops of r27 body begin with magic_ring r1 single_crochet 6 into magic_ring pull tight to close 6 r2 increase around 12 r3 increase single_crochet repeat around 18 r4 single_crochet increase single_crochet repeat around 24 r5 increase single_crochet 3 repeat around 30 r6-r25 single_crochet around 30 start stuffing here r26 in blo decrease single_crochet 3 repeat around 24 r27 single_crochet decrease single_crochet repeat around 18 r28 decrease single_crochet repeat around 12 finish stuffing firmly here r29 decrease around 6 cut end and weave through front loops of r29 to close weave in end attach yarn with a standing single_crochet to any stitch on r4 working diagonally insert a single_crochet into rounds 5 6 7 and 8 work 24 stitches around r8 working diagonally insert a single_crochet into rounds 7 6 5 and 4 cut yarn and join to first standing crochet weave in ends foot make 2 begin with magic_ring r1 single_crochet 6 into magic_ring pull tight to close 6 r2 increase around 12 r3 increase single_crochet repeat around 18 r4 single_crochet increase single_crochet repeat around 24 r5 increase single_crochet 3 repeat around 30 r6-r10 single_crochet around 30 r11 decrease single_crochet 3 repeat around 24 r12 single_crochet decrease single_crochet repeat around 18 r13 decrease single_crochet repeat around 12 stuff foot firmly here r14 decrease around 6 cut a long end and weave through front loops of r14 to close leave ends loose for sewing feet onto body sew feet on over rounds 21-24 of body on either side of the middle front use one end to stitch the feet together where they touch at the front as well your gnome is now complete place the hat on top to cover up the hidden treasure underneath if you want to use chenille yarn switch to a 4mm hook and cut 4 to 5 strands of worsted weight yarn for each beard stitch for blanket yarn use a 5 5 mm hook and 2 strands of blanket yarn for each stitch of the beard leave the yarn in its natural state - do not try to unravel see all the awesome pictures from my testers below for inspiration a
